intro: Grewia pervillei, commonly known as the red gum tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small to medium-sized tree that typically grows up to 10 meters in height. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a distinctive serrated margin. The tree is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils.
